The Galax Wastewater Treatment Facility (GWTF) accepts residential, commercial and industrial wastewater for treatment and discharge to the New River in compliance with all federal, state and local laws. A large quanity of chlorine, a highly hazardous chemical, is maintained at the facility and is used for disinfection as part of the wastewater treatment process. The amount of chlorine stored at the GWTF requires the City of Galax to implement and maintain a Risk Management Plan (RMP) under the Clean Air Act Section 112r(7) published in Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) part 68.

       The City of Galax maintains a RMP to reduce or eliminate the public and environmental consequences of an accidental hazardous chemical release from the GWTF. This RMP is a complex plan that includes hazard assessment, a formalized management system, an accident prevention program and an emergency response plan. The City of Galax also complies with the requirements of the Process Safety of Highly Hazardous Chemicals regulation 40 CFR 1910.119 that requires a Process Safety Management (PSM) program that includes wastewater treatment process hazards analysis, employee training, contractor control, safety procedures and safety reviews for the GWTF.

       The City of Galax uses the Emergency Response Plan (ERP) as an important tool for dealing with accidental chemical releases. The ERP establishes employee procedures for dealing with an accidental chemical release. These procedures include coordination with local emergency responders, public notification and employee measures to contain or end the chemical release. The ERP also provides for training and periodic safety reviews to ensure that the chances of an accidental release are minimized.

       Independent and internal audits of the RMP, PSM and ERP plans are preformed periodically to make certain that the programs are updated and working as intended to reduce or eliminate an accidental chemical release from

the GWTF.

       There have been no accidents during the previous five years of operation of the chlorination system at the GWTF.
